author: R Sivaraman
text:
Over Rs. 14 lakh has been spent towards air travel expenses of Lieutenant General A.K.Singh since his assumption office last July 17, as per information provided to a right to information (RTI) activist.

Lt Governor ofAndaman and Nicobar IslandsMr. Singh, was given additional charge of Union Territory of Puducherry last year after the then Lt. Governor Virendra Kataria was sacked shortly after the BJP Government came to power at the Centre.

According to the information obtained by Rajiv Gandhi Human Rights Awareness Organisation president P. Ragupathy, the private secretary-cum-public information officer of Raj Nivas disclosed that from the date of his assumption, Lt.Governor had made majority of his journeys to New Delhi and Port Blair, Andaman and Nicobar islands on official engagements.

Apart from these two cities, he has undertaken air journeys to Rajahmundry(en route Yanam), Mumbai, Bhopal, Kozhikode(en route Mahe), on official engagements.

Accompanying officers

The officers who had accompanied him on select occasions, when required, were T. Sreekanth secretary to Lt. Governor and Praveen Kumar Tripati, ADC to Lt. Governor. Total flight expenses from his assumption to last claim made was Rs.14,22,899. Flight expenses of officers who accompanied was given as Rs. 1,57,772.

Mr. Ragupathy said Mr. Singh was given additional charge one and half year ago. Since then Union Government has not taken any step to appoint a full time governor which can be taken as an indication of the scant importance it accords to the welfare of Union Territory of Puducherry.
title: Over 14 lakh spent on Pondy L-G's travel expenses
